definition: to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: The boy is so free and easy that he is always absent from school.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子太自由散漫以致经常旷课。
双鱼座是非常自由散漫的人。

sentences.english: This is 1 kind to breach discipline, freedom the false behavior of the desultoriness.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种违反纪律，自由散漫的错误行为。

sentences.english: Everything just obeys orders, obey discipline, there is no freedom desultoriness .
sentences.chinese: 一切都只是服从命令，遵守纪律，没有自由散漫。

definition: free and unconstrained (idiom); unfettered/unbuttoned/without care or worries
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to continue in one's own way (idiom)
coming and going alone (idiom); a lone operator/keeping to oneself/unsociable/maverick
to let sb do whatever they want/to indulge/to give free reins to/to let things slide/to drift aimlessly/laissez-faire
